# King of Thieves (2022 film)

| producer       = Femi Adebayo
| writer         =

King of Thieves (Agẹṣinkólé) is a 2022 Nigerian thriller film directed by directing duo Tope Adebayo and Adebayo Tijani and produced by Femi Adebayo. It stars Odunlade Adekola, Femi Adebayo, Toyin Abraham, Broda Shaggi, Adebowale "Debo" Adedayo aka Mr Macaroni, Lateef Adedimeji, Ibrahim Yekini (Itele D. Icon), and Ibrahim Chatta. The epic Yoruba-language film was produced by Femi Adebayo's Euphoria360 media and co-produced by Niyi Akinmolayan's Anthill Studios.
The film premiered on 4 April 2022, and began showing in cinemas nationwide from 8 April 2022.
Synopsis
Life in the renowned town and prosperous kingdom of Ajeromi was thriving, with peace and prosperity reigning supreme. However, the tranquility of the kingdom was disrupted when Agesinkole, a formidable bandit and terrorist, arrived to unleash terror upon its people.
Determined to protect their peaceful way of life, the inhabitants of Ajeromi united and used all their available resources against the menace of Agesinkole. Their arsenal included skilled hunters, powerful witches, and accomplished wizards who combined their strengths and abilities to confront this common threat and restore peace and prosperity to their beloved land.
Selected cast
*Femi Adebayo as Agesinkole
*Odunlade Adekola as King of Ajeromi
*Toyin Abraham as Queen of Ajeromi
*Ibrahim Chatta as Oguntade
*Lateef Adedimeji as Abegunde
*Toyosi Adesanya as Otin's Wife
*Aisha Lawal as Ariyibi
*Ibrahim Yekini as Abinbesu
*Olusegun Tunde as Wizard
*Soyombo Oluyombo as Aremo
*Kayode Olaiya as Oloye
*Rasaq Olayiwola as 1st Isoro
*Yinka Olaoye as 2nd Isoro
*Ebun Oloyede as 1st Olukosi
*Broda Shaggi
*Segun Arinze - Narrator
*Mr Macaroni
*Dele Odule as 2nd Otun
*Adebayo Salami as Alaremu
Premiere
King of Thieves (Agesinkole) premiered on Sunday, 4 April 2022, at the IMAX Cinemas, Lekki, Lagos. The theme of the premiere was 'epic and dangerous and lots of celebrities in attendance dressed in line with the theme. The event was star-studded and saw a lot of celebrities and big names of the industry in attendance. Some of those in attendance are Tade Ogidan, Tunde Kelani, Iyabo Ojo, Antar Laniyan, Segun Arinze, Mercy Aigbe, Dayo Amusa, Eniola Ajao, Denrele Edun, Muyiwa Ademola and a host of others. Popular media company, StarTimes, of which Femi Adebayo is an ambassador, hosted and congratulated him on the debut of his new movie in cinemas. Screening by the press, the StarTimes team, Nollywood industry icons, and movie critics took place at the Silverbird Cinemas, Ikeja City Mall.
